title: WhatsApp adapter via whatsapp-web.js
description: Add WhatsApp integration for personal use using whatsapp-web.js (unofficial Puppeteer-based client). Config key: settings.json `whatsapp: { enabled, allowedNumbers }`. Should mirror the Telegram adapter architecture. Note: requires Chrome/Chromium; QR code pairing on first run.

title: Semantic embeddings for memory_search
description: Add OpenAI/Ollama embedding support to memory-server.ts. SQLite chunk cache (bun:sqlite), hybrid cosine+keyword scoring, fallback to keyword when provider=none. Add memory.embeddings config section.

title: Slack adapter
description: Add Slack Socket Mode bot integration. Same message→runner→reply flow as the existing Telegram adapter. Socket Mode requires no public URL — just a bot token and app-level token. Implementation should mirror src/commands/telegram.ts. Config key: settings.json `slack: { botToken, appToken, allowedChannelIds }`.

title: Skills system — auto-load + agent-written skills
description:
Three sub-tasks:
- Auto-load all skills from ~/.claudeclaw/workspace/skills/ as system prompt context on every run (list skill names + descriptions so Claude knows what's available)
- Establish convention: Claude writes new skills to skills/ during runs with frontmatter `created_by: agent`
- Add `claudeclaw skills` CLI command to list installed skills (name, description, created_by)

title: memory_search and memory_get MCP tools
description: Implement memory_search and memory_get as a stdio MCP server (src/mcp/memory-server.ts). Expose via --mcp-config in runner.ts. Use section-based chunking and keyword scoring for search. Replace the whole-file system prompt injection with tool-based recall.

title: Webhook job triggers
description:
Allow jobs to be triggered via HTTP webhook instead of (or in addition to) cron schedule.
- Add `trigger: webhook` frontmatter option in job .md files
- Add POST /webhook/:job-name endpoint to the existing web server (src/ui/server.ts)
- Fire the job immediately when the endpoint is hit
- Optional: shared secret header for auth

title: Memory grooming — heartbeat prompt + auto-compact
description:
Three sub-tasks:
- Update heartbeat prompt (prompts/heartbeat/HEARTBEAT.md) to instruct Claude to update ~/.claudeclaw/workspace/MEMORY.md when it learns new preferences, facts, or patterns about the user
- Add `claudeclaw memory` CLI command to view/edit MEMORY.md in $EDITOR
- Auto-compact MEMORY.md when it exceeds ~4000 tokens: summarize oldest entries, keep recent ones verbatim
close_reason: Implemented all three parts: heartbeat prompt updated, memory CLI command added, auto-compact logic in runner.ts

title: Browser control via Playwright MCP
description:
Wire @playwright/mcp into daemon startup. Steps:
- Add @playwright/mcp as a dependency
- Generate ~/.claudeclaw/mcp.json on daemon start pointing to the playwright MCP server
- Pass `--mcp-config ~/.claudeclaw/mcp.json` to every `claude -p` invocation in runner.ts
- Add `browser` security level or document which existing levels permit browser tools
- Add `playwright` to allowedTools when browser is enabled in settings
